page.title: 03BIGGIN HILL AIRPORT
page.content:
BIGGIN HILL AIRPORT
The airport was built in 1917 and during the Second World War is was a famous fighter station in the Battle of Britain. The airport is about 170 metres above sea level and it overlooks London. The London Borough of Bromley now owns the airport, which is open for approximately 4,000 hours per year with an aeroplane landing or taking off every 1.75 minutes. The main runway is 1,837 metres long and the largest plane to have used the airport is a Boeing 747. Based at the airport are ten flying clubs and flying for recreation is important, especially at weekends. A number of commercial business organisations have planes based at the airfield and these are used for executive and freight transport.
